messages.message:
*Cypress On-Call Updates for July 8-12:*
We have mostly moved past persistent failures, which is great because the consistent failure results that we do see are actual bugs! We’re basically only dealing with flakiness on Crafting now. A few other causes are bad test code itself or envs that got messed up / were not correctly setup
• Flakiness example: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1720811867043189
• Real bug discovered: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05EQQJGN7L/p1720630631397669
    ◦ And we managed to get a revert for it merged within a day! We avoided catastrophe on app runs.
Currently the top 5 flakey tests are:
• aihub-refinement-udf.spec.ts @CJ
• aihub-validation-udf.spec.ts (though it sounds like Elan has a solution for it (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1720819259684699?thread_ts=1720811867.043189&cid=CSY11CK7T)!)
• converse-app.spec.ts @Aayush
• aihub-classification.spec.ts @Serena
• review-manager-dashboard.spec.ts @Udit
We should make Jira tickets for each flakey test so that we actually track and can officially dedicate time to investigate and fix them - (for example, I find myself forgetting about previous weeks’ Cypress action items even if I’m tagged…)
Misc: I made some documentation to hopefully make Cypress less of a pain in the future!
• https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1720735446465179
• https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1720568627386209
Basically, I had a very easy week as on-call. Thanks to everyone (especially previous cypress-on-calls) for making Cypress so much more stable!
